lines.content: Chip the Squirrel is a personal assistant chatbot created from a greenfield Java project template as part of the software engineering module CS2103T. Inspired by the neat way squirrels organise their nut stashes, Chip will help you keep tasks neat and organised too!
Instructions on how to use the app can be found in the [User Guide](http://samuelfangjw.github.io/ip/).

Hi I'm Chip the Squirrel, a personal assistant chatbot to help you keep track of your deadlines, events and todos.
1. Ensure you have `Java 11` or above installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for Chip the Squirrel.
4. Double-click the file to start the app. The GUI should appear in a few seconds.
5. Type the command in the command box and press Enter to execute it.
6. Refer to `Features` below for details on available commands.
Below are some commands that I understand. Commands are not case-sensitive, so I understand 'help', 'Help' and 'HELP'.
Words in `UPPER_CASE` are parameters to be supplied by the user.
`(Round Brackets)` are used to denote optional parameters.
`...` is used to denote that one or more parameters are accepted.
The help command helps you remember what each command does. Help is always a 'help' away!
Typing `help` will display the commands that are available. Typing help followed by the name of the command will display
more info on how the command can be used.
The bye command quits the application. Don't worry I'll remember all your tasks the next time you come back!
Add a todo and I'll remember it for you!
Typing `todo` followed by a description adds a todo to your list of tasks.
DESCRIPTION can be made out of one or many words.
Add a deadline and I'll remember it for you!
Typing `deadline` followed by a description, date and optional time field adds a deadline to your list of tasks.
DESCRIPTION can be made out of one or many words.
DATE should be in yyyy-mm-dd format
(TIME) is optional and should be in hh:mm format
Add an event and I'll remember it for you!
Typing `event` followed by a description, date and optional time field adds an event to your list of tasks.
DESCRIPTION can be made out of one or many words.
DATE should be in yyyy-mm-dd format
(TIME) is optional and should be in hh:mm format
I can list out your task for you!
Displays a list of all tasks.
You can let me know what tasks you have completed!
Typing `done` followed by the task number marks the task as done. A `[X]` signifies that a task has been completed. If
you are unsure of the task number, you can list out all tasks using the `list` command.
Let me know if you would like a task to be deleted forever. Don't worry any secrets are safe with me!
Typing `delete` followed by the task number deletes the task. If you are unsure of the task number, you can list out all
Let me know what you are looking for!
You can search for a task using the find command. One or more search parameters are accepted. The program will attempt
to find all tasks that contain any of the search parameters. Search parameters are case-insensitive.
I'll remember your tasks automatically, no need to worry!

"Hello! I'm Chip the Squirrel! How can I help you today? If you need any help, type \"help\".";
private static final String GOODBYE_MESSAGE = "Bye! Hope to see you again soon!";
* Returns a message to be shown after a task is successfully marked as done.
* @param task task to be marked as done.
* @return Message shown after task is successfully marked as done.
assert task != null : "task should not be null";
return joinStringsWithNewLines("Good Job! I've marked this task as done!",
* Returns a message to be shown after a task is successfully deleted.
* @param numTasks Number of tasks left in the list.
* @return Message shown after task is successfully deleted.
public static String getSuccessfullyDeletedMessage(int numTasks, Task task) {
String formattedTasksCount = numTasks > 1 ? String.format("%d tasks", numTasks) : "1 task";
assert task != null : "task should not be null";
return joinStringsWithNewLines("Got it! I've removed this task:",
"Now you have " + formattedTasksCount + " in the list.");
* Returns a string representation of list of tasks.
* Tasks should already be filtered by search command.
* @return string representation of list of tasks.
assert tasks != null : "tasks should not be null";
outputArr[0] = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";
* Returns a string representation of list of all tasks.
* @return string representation of list of tasks.
assert tasks != null : "tasks should not be null";
return "You have not added any tasks.";
* Returns a message to be shown after a task is successfully added.
* @param numTasks Number of tasks left in the list.
* @return Message shown after task is successfully added.
public static String getSuccessfullyAddedTaskMessage(int numTasks, Task task) {
String formattedTasksCount = numTasks > 1 ? String.format("%d tasks", numTasks) : "1 task";
assert task != null : "task should not be null";
return joinStringsWithNewLines("Got it! I've added this task:",
"Now you have " + formattedTasksCount + " in the list.");

<javafx.scene.layout.HBox alignment="TOP_RIGHT" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" maxWidth="1.7976931348623157E308" opacity="0.65" prefWidth="400.0" spacing="10.0" style="-fx-border-color: #000000; -fx-border-radius: 15px; -fx-background-color: #000000; -fx-background-radius: 15px;">
<Label fx:id="dialog" maxHeight="1.7976931348623157E308" minHeight="-Infinity" prefWidth="383.0" text="Label" textFill="WHITE" wrapText="true" />

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" stylesheets="@MainStyle.css" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/8.0.171" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="chip.ui.MainWindow">

<TextField fx:id="userInput" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" promptText="How can I help you today?" style="-fx-background-color: transparent; -fx-text-fill: #FFFFFF;" />

<Button mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" style="-fx-background-color: transparent; -fx-text-fill: #FFFFFF;" text="Send" GridPane.columnIndex="1" />

<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" fitToWidth="true" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" style="-fx-background-color: transparent; -fx-background: transparent" vbarPolicy="ALWAYS" vvalue="1.0">
